conclusion: Landmark study: MTHFR 677TT genotype produces thermolabile enzyme with ~30% residual activity. Elevated plasma homocysteine in TT individuals.
Meta-analysis: MTHFR 677TT associated with significantly increased neural tube defect risk (OR 1.98, 95% CI 1.72-2.28).
Meta-analysis: MTHFR 677TT associated with increased coronary heart disease risk (OR 1.16), effect modified by folate status.
MTHFR 1298CC homozygotes showed reduced enzyme activity. Compound heterozygotes (677CT/1298AC) had biochemical profile similar to 677TT.
MTR 2756GG genotype associated with altered homocysteine metabolism and increased neural tube defect risk in folate-deplete populations.
MTRR 66GG associated with elevated homocysteine and increased NTD risk, particularly when combined with low B12.
Meta-analysis: COMT Val158Met Met/Met associated with better cognitive performance (d=0.12) but increased anxiety and pain sensitivity.
COMT Met/Met genotype associated with higher prefrontal cortex dopamine and improved working memory under low-stress conditions.
NAMPT rs61330082 T allele associated with lower circulating visfatin/NAMPT levels and increased metabolic syndrome risk.
SIRT1 rs7895833 GG genotype associated with increased visceral adiposity and insulin resistance. G allele is an independent cardiovascular risk factor.
SIRT1 genetic variants modulate caloric restriction response. GG carriers showed attenuated sirtuin activation with fasting.
NADSYN1 variants associated with circulating NAD+ metabolite levels in large-scale metabolomics GWAS. NAD+ decline with age is genetically modifiable.
